```{r libraries, warning=FALSE,message=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
library(magrittr)
library(ggplot2)
library(ggparliament)
library(tidyr)
```

```{r}
#get the data for the last election
uk <- election_data %>%
  filter(country == "UK") %>%
  filter(year == 2017) %>%
  #parl_data it out
  parliament_data(election_data = .,
                  party_seats = .$seats,
                  parl_rows = 12,
                  #can't think of a way to do this without grouping by (e.g.) government
                  group = .$government,
                  type = "opposing_benches")

#plot it
plot <- ggplot(uk, aes(x, y, colour = party_short)) +
  geom_parliament_seats()

```
